docs.lead_paragraph: New estimates that President Barack Obama's health care law will encourage millions of Americans to leave the workforce or reduce their work hours have touched off an I-told-you-so chorus from Republicans, who've claimed all along that the law will kill jobs. But some aren't telling it straight.

headline.main: FACT CHECK: Anti-Obamacare Chorus Is Off Key
headline.print_headline: FACT CHECK: Anti-Obamacare Chorus Is Off Key

docs.lead_paragraph: "The Americans used the games to wage a propaganda campaign in support of a boycott of the 1980 Summer Games in Moscow. Despite the harsh psychological setting, Soviet athletes performed notably." — The in-flight magazine of Russian Aeroflot airline on the 1980 Lake Placid Games, in its review of past Winter Games.

docs.lead_paragraph: Seattle is a city not widely known for inchoate screaming and wildness. Until this football season, that is.

headline.main: ‘Chill’ Seattle Savors Its Super Bowl Moment in the Sun
headline.print_headline: ‘Chill’ Seattle Savors Its Super Bowl Moment in the Sun

docs.abstract: Hundreds of thousands of people crowd six-deep or more in Seattle, along closed streets for a celebratory parade over their city's first Super Bowl win; Seattle Seahawks opened a civic-size pressure release valve for a city that is not widely known for inchoate screaming and wildness.
docs.snippet: Seattle is a city not widely known for inchoate screaming and wildness. Until this football season, that is.

docs.lead_paragraph: Allowing employers to duck the birth control insurance mandate would violate the establishment clause, which enforces the separation of church and state.
docs.abstract: Editorial argues Constitution's establishment clause may be Justice Department's strongest argument against corporations whose owners want religious exemption from providing contraception to employees under health care law; says clause, which enforces separation of church and state, takes precedence over Religious Freedom Restoration Act of 1993 and prevents employers from invoking act to force religious beliefs onto employees.
docs.snippet: Allowing employers to duck the birth control insurance mandate would violate the establishment clause, which enforces the separation of church and state.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The story about a pending abortion case is less about a grandmother counseling women than it is a claim by religion for primacy in the public square.
docs.snippet: The story about a pending abortion case is less about a grandmother counseling women than it is a claim by religion for primacy in the public square.

docs.lead_paragraph: The economics of urban living often mean that brothers and sisters must share bedrooms. But when does it become a case of oversharing?
docs.abstract: Some male and female siblings in New York City have to share bedroom due to high apartment prices and limited space associated with urban life; arrangement has led some parents to question its effect on children's social and sexual development.
docs.snippet: The economics of urban living often mean that brothers and sisters must share bedrooms. But when does it become a case of oversharing?

docs.lead_paragraph: The drugstore chain sees itself as a health care provider and says the sale of cigarettes doesn’t fit that image, even though the company stands to lose $2 billion in sales.

headline.main: CVS Vows to Quit Selling Tobacco Products
headline.print_headline: CVS Vows to Quit Selling Tobacco Products

docs.abstract: Drugstore chain CVS Caremark says it plans to stop selling cigarettes and other tobacco products by October 2014; sees itself as health care provider and says sale of cigarettes does not fit that image, even though the company stands to lose $2 billion in sales.
docs.snippet: The drugstore chain sees itself as a health care provider and says the sale of cigarettes doesn’t fit that image, even though the company stands to lose $2 billion in sales.

docs.lead_paragraph: While CVS Caremark Corp. is removing tobacco in an effort to focus more on being a health care provider, don't expect it or other companies with a similar focus to cut out other vices.

headline.main: CVS Snuff Out Tobacco, Stops There
headline.print_headline: CVS Snuff Out Tobacco, Stops There

docs.snippet: While CVS Caremark Corp. is removing tobacco in an effort to focus more on being a health care provider, don't expect it or other companies with a similar focus to cut out other vices.

docs.lead_paragraph: Conservative Republicans differed on Wednesday over their party's approach to raising the U.S. debt ceiling, underscoring the challenges faced by House Speaker John Boehner as Congress considers the Obama administration's request for an increase in the federal government's borrowing authority.

headline.main: Conservative Lawmakers Split on Debt Limit Increase
headline.print_headline: Conservative Lawmakers Split on Debt Limit Increase

docs.lead_paragraph: House Republican leaders are struggling to devise a way forward on must-do legislation to increase the government's borrowing cap.

headline.main: House GOP Struggles on Looming Debt Limit Hike
headline.print_headline: House GOP Struggles on Looming Debt Limit Hike

docs.snippet: House Republican leaders are struggling to devise a way forward on must-do legislation to increase the government's borrowing cap.
